fr.sii.ogham.sms.sender.impl.cloudhopper.encoder

Class CloudhopperCharsetSupportingEncoder

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.sii.ogham.sms.sender.impl.cloudhopper.encoder.CloudhopperCharsetSupportingEncoder
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Encoder, SupportingEncoder

    public class CloudhopperCharsetSupportingEncoder
extends Object
implements SupportingEncoder
    An Encoder that checks if the message can be encoded with a particular Charset.

    To test if message can be encoded by the provided Charset, the message is first encoded into a byte array and then the byte array is decoded into a string (using Charset.normalize(CharSequence) method). If the result of normalization has not the same length, it means that the Charset can't handle the message properly.

    Moreover, Charset implementations use '?' character if a character of original string can't be properly converted. Therefore, the number of '?' characters are count before and after normalization. If the number is not the same, it means that the Charset can't handle the message properly.

    Author:
    Aur√©lien Baudet
